subject: Re: [junit] Re: How to build customised runner?.
msgSnippet: Madava, You may want to try the code submitted in this tracker item:
messageBody:
Madava,

You may want to try the code submitted in this tracker item:

http://sourceforge.net/tracker/index.php?func=detail&aid=1647993&group_id=15278&atid=365278

I didn't write it, so I can't vouch for it, but it claims to have
similar goals to yours. Thanks,

David Saff

On Wed, Nov 12, 2008 at 5:02 AM, madavahegde <madavahegde@...> wrote:
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "James Abley" <james.abley@...> wrote:
>>
>> 2008/11/11 madavahegde <madavahegde@...>:
>
>> > --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Nat Pryce" <nat.pryce@> wrote:
>> >>
>> >> 2008/11/10 madavahegde <madavahegde@>:
>> >
>> >> > I want to gnerate test cases at run time . TO achieve this i
> feel like
>> >> > i need to use customised runner.
>> >>
>> >> It will probably be easier to use a parameterised test than to write
>> >> your own test runner.
>> >>
>> >> --Nat
>> >>
>> >> --
>> >> Random musings at http://www.natpryce.com
>> >>
>> >
>> > Thanks foir your suggestion.
>> >
>> > I tried to use parameterised test cases. On eproblem i found was it is
>> > going to create test case names like method[0], method[1]..........
>> > I need to get some meaning full name there. Is there any way to
>> > achieve this.
>> >
>>
>> Can you share why you need more meaningful names? Could you pass a
>> parameter into each test which would give you more meaningful failure
>> messages, for example?
>>
>> Cheers,
>>
>> James
>>
> Hi James,
>
> If there is no provision to get meaningful name then i can go ahead
> with getting meaningful message. But in our application junit test
> cases are integrated with cruise control builder. In cruisecontrol it
> will displayed with only method names. On the very first look at
> failures will not show what is actually failed.
>
>
